question: When is it?
answer: HackNEU 2017 will take place on 11-12 February 2017.

question: How much does it cost?
answer: HackNEU is completely free for Graduate and PHD students of Northeastern University and includes free food, drinks, swag and prizes.

question: What should I bring?
answer: All you need is your student ID, a laptop+charger, and any hardware you want to hack on - we will publish list of hardware we can manage for you if you will ask for it and we will try our best to arrange it for you! :D

question: Who can come?
answer: HackNEU 2017 is ONLY open to Graduates+PhD students and alumni of Northeastern University.

question: Do I have to know how to code?
answer: Absolutely not! A hackathon is the perfect place and time to learn. There will be mentors available to ease you through your first hackathon experience.

question: How do teams work?
answer: Teams can be up to 4 people. All teammates must register individually.

question: Will there be hardware?
answer: We are working to secure hardware, and participants are welcome to bring their own hardware to hack on.

question: What can I win?
answer: Awesome prizes and more stuff you will be amazed by - more details *coming soon*

question: Will we be allowed to hack on existing projects or work from home during the hackathon?
answer: No and no. This is obviously difficult to enforce, so please have respect for other competitors and follow these rules on an honor code basis.

question: What is the work of Volunteer?
answer: Volunteers will basically be there to help with the event to make the lives of participants as easy as possible. Tasks include but are not limited to setting up food table, drinks, guide students with any questions they have, redirect them to mentors, event heads, helping judges to do their task better, make new friends and most of all have a good time learning how to host a hackathon.

question: If I am a Volunteer can I participate in Hackathon?
answer: You will not be able to participate in this Hackathon if you are a Volunteer to help.

question: What if I registered as a Volunteer but I can't make it to Hackathon?
answer: Please send an email to teamhackneu@gmail.com with an email subject as Volunteer - YourName - Not able to attend - Day 11-Feb-2017/12-Feb-2017 or Both.

question: What if I registered as a Volunteer by accident?
answer: Please send an email to teamhackneu@gmail.com with an email subject as Volunteer - YourName - Not able to attend - Day 11-Feb/12-Feb or Both.

question: What if I got confirmation to attend the hackathon but I can't make it?
answer: Please send an email to teamhackneu@gmail.com with email subject as Participant - Your email id - Not able to attend HackNEU 2017.

question: What if I didn't get confirmation to attend the event can I still attend?
answer: No. We will send you an email confirmation if you have been selected to attend the event before 1 week of the event. Some of you might be on waitlist and will be able to get the spot if others drop out. Do not loose hope. We have plenty of spots.
